thread.title: Manchester United's clash with St Etienne passes off peacefully
thread.title_full: Manchester United's clash with St Etienne passes off peacefully

author: Chris Slater
title: Manchester United's clash with St Etienne passes off peacefully
text:
News Manchester United's clash with St Etienne passes off peacefully Police made just two arrests as the French club played at Old Trafford in the Europa League last 32 fixture Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Just two fans were arrested as police Manchester United’s clash with St Etienne passed off “without major incident.” 
The French side were given around 3,500 tickets for the Europa League last 32 match at Old Trafford this evening and police said they expected “significant numbers” to make the trip across the Channel. 
The mood was peaceful before the game with the fans of the Ligue 1 club congregating in Exchange Square and turning it into a feast of colour and noise. 
They were then given an official police escort from the city centre to Old Trafford at around 5pm with a rolling road block put in place. St Etienne fans on their way from the city centre to Old Trafford The fans were then given a police escort (Photo: Sean Hansford) 
Shots fired at house after group of 12 men turn up banging on front door 
After the end of tonight’s game, GMP confirmed the game had passed without major incident with just two supporters were arrested, one on suspicion of assault and the other to prevent a breach of the peace. 
Match commander Superintendent Leor Giladi said: “This has been another challenging but successful operation for Greater Manchester Police. 
“Our officers and staff have performed to the highest of standards to ensure a safe and successful outcome. 
“The Saint-Étienne supporters came to Manchester in large numbers and, to their credit, engaged fully with us to ensure a lively atmosphere. 
“Both sets of supporters represented their clubs well and I hope everybody enjoyed their trip to Old Trafford. St Etienne fans enjoying themselves in Exchange Square ahead of the game (Photo: Sean Hansford) Man charged with drink driving after M62 crash involving car and HGV 
“I would also like to thank the people of Manchester for their continued co-operation in the policing of these events; your support makes a big difference.” 
St Etienne are likely to face sanction from UEFA however after a large number pyrotechnics were let off in the away section before kick-off. 
Dozens of flares were illuminated sending plumes of smoke across the pitch as the match began with many United supporters questioning how they were able to smuggle them into the ground. 
United take a 3-0 lead to France for the second leg next Wednesday after a Zlatan Ibrahimovic hat-trick put the Reds in pole position in the tie. Like us on Facebook
